snippet: Two police evidence warehouses holding guns, drugs and DNA material were flooded during Hurricane Sandy, and the damage is now having an impact on the courts.
abstract: Flooding of two New York City Police Dept warehouses during Hurricane Sandy has resulted in a loss of evidence that has so far impacted six criminal trials, with more problems likely to emerge; warehouses held guns, drugs and 9,846 barrels of evidence containing sensitive DNA material.
lead_paragraph: Two police evidence warehouses holding guns, drugs and DNA material were flooded during Hurricane Sandy, and the damage is now having an impact on the courts.

headline.seo: Hurricane Destroyed Evidence Held by New York Police
headline.main: Flooding of 2 Police Warehouses Destroys Evidence Needed for Criminal Trials
headline.print_headline: Flooding of 2 Police Warehouses Destroys Evidence Needed for Criminal Trials
